article.headline: Nebraska 69, TCU 57
article.story: FORT WORTH, Texas -- Bo Spencer scored 22 points as Nebraska defeated TCU 69-57 on Saturday night. Nebraska (6-3) held the Horned Frogs to just four points in the first eight minutes of the second half. The Cornhuskers took the lead for good, 47-45, with 10:14 to play on Jorge Brian Diaz's putback. TCU (7-3) scored only 20 points and shot 24 percent in the second half. Kyan Anderson's jumper with 5:07 to play was the Frogs' last made shot from the field. Hank Thorns had 18 points and Anderson 15 for TCU. With three seconds left in the first half, Spencer caught an inbound pass, bobbled it, recovered and hit an off-balance 60-footer at the buzzer to cut TCU's led to 37-30 at halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
